accounts.title: Email Accounts
accounts.description: Manage and configure your email accounts.
accounts.noAccountConfigurationsDesc: You haven't added any Account configurations yet. Add one to start using Account features.
accounts.name: Login Name
accounts.emailAccountRegistrationDesc: Please provide your email address. In the next steps, you will configure the IMAP/SMTP details. Using this email address, we will attempt to automatically retrieve the SMTP/IMAP server addresses.
accounts.nameDescription: IMAP Connection Username. Leave this field blank if you use your full email address as the connection username.
accounts.emailCannotBeModified: The email account address cannot be modified when editing.
accounts.accountUpdatedDesc: Your account has been successfully updated.
accounts.accountCreatedDesc: Your account has been successfully created.
accounts.updateFailed: Update failed, please try again later
accounts.creationFailed: Creation failed, please try again later
accounts.allMailFolderSelectedDesc: Selecting folders with the "All Mail" attribute will likely lead to duplicating messages already synced from folders like Inbox and Sent. This may consume significantly more storage space.
accounts.allMailSkipped: Selected standard folders. 'All Mail' was skipped to avoid duplicates.
accounts.selectAtLeastOneFolder: Please select at least one folder
accounts.chooseFoldersToSync: Choose folders to sync for {{email}}, Newly added folders will begin downloading during the next sync cycle.
accounts.chooseEncryptionMethod: Choose the encryption method for IMAP.
accounts.chooseAuthMethod: Choose the authentication method for IMAP.
accounts.leaveEmptyToKeepPassword: Leave empty to keep current password
accounts.leaveEmptyToKeepExisting: Leave empty to keep the existing password, or enter a new password to update it.
accounts.enabledDescription: Determines whether this account is active. If disabled, related syncs will not run.
accounts.theAccountHasNotCompletedTheAuthorizatio: The account has not completed the authorization process. Please
accounts.detailsOfTheOAuth2TokensForTheAccount: Details of the OAuth2 tokens for the account.
accounts.thisAccountIsUsedForIdentificationPurpos: This account is used for identification purposes only and does not require syncing with an email server. It helps with importing email data.
accounts.determinesWhetherThisAccountIsActiveNoSy: Determines whether this account is active. If disabled, the account will not be able to import data.

runningState.accountNotStarted: Account synchronization may not have started yet

accounts.imapProxy: Use a SOCKS5 proxy for IMAP connections.
accounts.syncStartDateDescription: Defines the sync start date — either specific or relative to now. Preceding emails are excluded, {{fixedPart}}.
accounts.syncAfterDate: syncs data after a set date
accounts.syncRecentData: shifts the sync date over time, syncing only recent data
accounts.folderLimitDescription: Limit the number of emails to sync per folder (minimum 100). Leave empty for no limit.
accounts.areYouSureYouWantTo: Are you sure you want to {{action}} this account?
accounts.thisWillPreventTheAccountFromBeingUsed: This account will no longer sync data from the IMAP server, but existing data will still be accessible.
accounts.useDangerousDescription: Enable this option only if you are connecting to an IMAP server with a public or self-signed certificate that may not be recognized by your system. Using this setting bypasses standard certificate validation, which can expose you to man-in-the-middle attacks. Only enable if you understand the risks.

mailbox.title: Mailbox
mailbox.selectFolder: Select a folder to view messages

deleteDialog.title: Delete Email
deleteDialog.desc: Are you sure you want to delete {{countText}}? This action will delete the selected email(s) from local database. The email(s) will be permanently deleted and cannot be recovered.

search.sizeDescription: The size refers to the total email size, including attachments.
search.title: Search
search.startSearching: Start by entering a keyword, sender, or using advanced filters.
search.adjustSearch: Try adjusting your search criteria or clearing filters.
search.subject: Subject
search.noMailboxSelectAccount: No mailbox. Please select an account first.
search.pleaseSelectAtLeastOne: Please select at least one search condition

delete.title: Delete messages
delete.confirmPrefix: Are you sure you want to delete

delete.successDesc: The selected messages have been deleted successfully.

mail.subject: Subject
mail.onlyNonInlineAttachments: Only non-inline attachments are shown here.

oauth2.title: OAuth2
oauth2.noConfigurationsDesc: You haven't added any OAuth2 configurations yet. Add one to start using OAuth2 features.
oauth2.description: Automatically handling access token retrieval, storage, and refreshing, ensuring a seamless and always-ready authentication experience.
oauth2.whenDisabled: When disabled: - New authorization flows will be rejected immediately - Existing access tokens and refresh tokens will be revoked within 1 minute - Users must re-authorize when re-enabled
oauth2.theUniqueIdentifierForYourApplication: The unique identifier for your application, provided by the OAuth provider.
oauth2.leaveEmptyToKeepExistingSecret: Leave empty to keep existing secret
oauth2.leaveEmptyToKeepTheExistingSecret: Leave empty to keep the existing secret. Only enter a new value if you want to change it.
oauth2.aSecretKeyProvidedByTheOAuthProvider: A secret key provided by the OAuth provider to authenticate your application.
oauth2.theUrlWhereUsersWillBeRedirected: The URL where users will be redirected to authorize your application.
oauth2.theUrlUsedToExchange: The URL used to exchange the authorization code for an access token.
oauth2.theRedirectUrlAfterAuthorization: The redirect URL after authorization. It must match the one registered with the OAuth provider. Use the format http://[host]:[port]/oauth2/callback (or https://), where [host] and [port] match your RustMailer deployment. The path /oauth2/callback is fixed.
oauth2.useSocks5ProxyForOAuthRequests: Use SOCKS5 proxy for OAuth requests when direct access is blocked.
oauth2.describeThePurposeOfTheOauth2Application: Describe the purpose of the oauth2 application
oauth2.yourOAuth2ApplicationHasBeenSuccessfully: Your OAuth2 application has been successfully {{action}}.
oauth2.authorizeAnEmailAccountToStartTheOAuth2A: Authorize an email account to start the OAuth2 authorization process.
oauth2.noEmailAccountsRegistered: No email accounts registered. Please create one.
oauth2.getAuthorizeUrlFailedDesc: get authorize url failed, please try again later
oauth2.statusUpdateFailed: Status update failed, please try again later
oauth2.areYouSureYouWantTo: Are you sure you want to {{action}} this OAuth2 client?
oauth2.thisWillPreventTheOAuth2ClientFromBeingU: This will prevent the OAuth2 client from being used.
oauth2.areYouSureYouWantToDelete: Are you sure you want to delete
oauth2.thisActionWillPermanentlyRemoveTheOauth2: This action will permanently remove the oauth2 record from the system. This cannot be undone.
oauth2.pleaseBeCareful: Please be carefull, this operation can not be rolled back.
oauth2.yourOAuth2ApplicationHasBeenSuccessfully: Your OAuth2 application has been successfully deleted.
oauth2.deleteFailed: Delete failed, please try again later
oauth2.successMessage: Your email account has been successfully authenticated via OAuth2. The Access Token has been saved by the system and will be automatically updated as needed.
oauth2.noStatus: This page displays the result of your OAuth2 authentication. Currently, no specific status is available. Please try again if needed.

accessTokens.title: Access Tokens
accessTokens.name: Name
accessTokens.noTokensDesc: You haven't created any access tokens yet. Create one to start using API features.
accessTokens.description: Manage your access tokens, their access controls, IP whitelists, and rate-limiting settings here.
accessTokens.selectMultipleAccountsForTheAccessToken: Select multiple accounts for the access token's authorization scope.
accessTokens.enterOneIpAddressPerLine:
Enter one IP address per line, e.g.:
192.168.1.1
192.168.1.2
accessTokens.aListOfIpAddressesAllowed: A list of IP addresses allowed to access the resource. Enter one IP address per line. (Optional)
accessTokens.theMaximumNumberOfRequestsAllowed: The maximum number of requests allowed within the interval. (Optional)
accessTokens.theTimeWindowForTheRateLimit: The time window (in seconds) for the rate limit. (Optional)
accessTokens.describeThePurposeOfTheAccessToken: Describe the purpose of the access token
accessTokens.yourAccessTokenHasBeenSuccessfully: Your access token has been successfully {{action}}.
accessTokens.quotaMustBeAPositiveInteger: Quota must be a positive integer.
accessTokens.intervalMustBeAPositiveInteger: Interval must be a positive integer.
accessTokens.invalidIpAddressesFound: Invalid IP addresses found. Please enter valid IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.
accessTokens.atLeastOneAccountIsRequired: At least one account is required.
accessTokens.theListOfAccountsThatCanBeQueried: The list of accounts that can be queried using an access token.
accessTokens.filterByEmailAddressOrAccountId: Filter by email address or account ID...
accessTokens.aclRulesForAccessTokens: ACL rules for access tokens include IP whitelist verification and rate limit enforcement.

settings.enterProxyIdToConfirmDeletion: Enter Proxy Id to confirm deletion.
settings.pleaseUseAnIpAddressForBetterReliability: Please use an IP address (e.g., 127.0.0.1) rather than a hostname or domain for better reliability.
